titles.title: No Substitute for Quality Teaching Demonstration Act

To direct the Secretary of Education to establish a competitive demonstration grant program to provide funds for local educational agencies to experiment with ways to alleviate the substitute teacher shortage, and for other purposes.
No Substitute for Quality Teaching Demonstration Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.

committee.name: House Education and the Workforce
committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education

bill.summary: No Substitute for Quality Teaching Demonstration Act - Directs the Secretary of Education to establish a competitive demonstration grant program to provide grants for a single academic year directly to between 50 and 100 local educational agencies, or to regional consortia of such agencies acting together, that vary geographically and socioeconomically, to enable them to experiment with ways to alleviate the substitute teacher shortage.
